page.title: 18Rosscarrock Farm
page.content: Rosscarrok farm is between Port Isaac and Port Quin.It is a beef and cereal farm.It has been there for a very long time and was mentioned in the original Domesday Book.In the 13th century it was a monastery and some of the old buidings are still there as well as a monks walk and an old holy well.The old barns are made of stone and granite with slate rooves,some with pidgeon roosts.They are not used any more as they are not suitable for modern farming methods.The new buildings are made from metal,wood asbestos concrete,corugated iron.They are used to store hay and for cattle in the winter.They are very open so that modern machinery can be stored in them.The grain is stored in big metal bins called silos.There are 4 holding 60 tons of grain and 1 holding 90 tons.
